32/*
33 * These are not really semaphores; they are just reader/writer sleep
34 * locks, whereas what Linux calls an rwlock is a reader/writer spin
35 * lock.
36 *
37 * Notes on porting:
38 *
39 * - Linux does not have destroy_rwsem. You must add it yourself in
40 * the appropriate place.
41 */
42
43#ifndef _LINUX_RWSEM_H_
44#define _LINUX_RWSEM_H_
45
46#include <sys/mutex.h>
47
48struct rw_semaphore {
49 krwlock_t rws_lock;
50};
51
52static inline void
53init_rwsem(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
54{
55
56 rw_init(&rwsem->rws_lock);
57}
58
59static inline void
60destroy_rwsem(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
61{
62
63 rw_destroy(&rwsem->rws_lock);
64}
65
66static inline void
67down_read(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
68{
69
70 rw_enter(&rwsem->rws_lock, RW_READER);
71}
72
73static inline bool
74down_read_trylock(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
75{
76
77 return rw_tryenter(&rwsem->rws_lock, RW_READER);
78}
79
80static inline void
81down_write(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
82{
83
84 rw_enter(&rwsem->rws_lock, RW_WRITER);
85}
86
87static inline void
88up_read(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
89{
90
91 rw_exit(&rwsem->rws_lock);
92}
93
94static inline void
95up_write(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
96{
97
98 rw_exit(&rwsem->rws_lock);
99}
100
101static inline void
102downgrade_write(struct rw_semaphore *rwsem)
103{
104
105 rw_downgrade(&rwsem->rws_lock);
106}
107
108#endif /* _LINUX_RWSEM_H_ */
109
